description.hltext_display: Let's not undo 50 years of progress on racial equality
description.content:
On Monday, in Charleston, the people nostalgic for the confederacy held a “secession ball.”
Let’s be clear: The reason for secession was to preserve slavery. The following is from Mississippi’s Secession Declaration: “Our position is thoroughly identified with the institution of slavery — the greatest material interest of the world … The hostility to this institution … has grown until it denies the right of property in slaves … It refuses the admission of new slave States into the Union … It has made combinations and formed associations to carry out its schemes of emancipation in the States and wherever else slavery exists …”
The secession of the Southern states unleashed our Civil War, which did indeed result in the abolition of slavery. But within 20 years, white supremacy reasserted itself and, with organized violence, Ku Klux Klan terrorism and lynchings, blacks were pushed back to the edges of poverty and desperation, denied the rights of citizenship and the ballot. That’s the way it was for almost 100 years, until the civil rights movement challenged the institutions and culture of Jim Crow.
Earlier this month I toured the Civil Rights Memorial in Alabama. It featured the life stories of almost 100 people who had been killed in the civil rights movement. They were killed because they were organizing to end segregation. They were killed because they were trying to finish the unfinished business of the Civil War. They created history that we can touch — it happened just a few decades ago.
From this memorial I walked two blocks to the Alabama State Capitol and looked down at the gold star on the steps where Jefferson Davis took the oath of office for the presidency of the Confederacy. He is still celebrated in Alabama and throughout the South with official state holidays.
It was a strange feeling, to go from a memorial to freedom fighters to a tribute to the slaveholder who led the Confederacy, and directed its fight for the preservation of slavery. A man still held in reverence.
On the same trip I visited the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial in Atlanta. It combined the narrative of the civil rights movement with Martin Luther King Jr.’s arc of life, even to the horse-drawn cart in which his body was taken to be buried after his assassination. But it is not a pleasant walk to the memorial. You move through urban desolation and human desperation and poverty — black poverty. You witness the embedded embers of inequality in our country.
We have a lot of unfinished business in this country, and not only in the South. Just a few years ago a small group of Seattle parents sued the Seattle School District to overturn the policy of racial tiebreakers when filling slots at Ballard High School. This suit went all the way to the U.S. Supreme Court, which threw out the tiebreaking policies, with the blind argument that this whole issue of prejudice against blacks was settled a few decades ago, so it just isn’t relevant.
Wouldn’t it be nice if it was that easy. But we know it isn’t, and it gets harder in a great recession when unemployment and falling incomes hit blacks and whites, Hispanics and Native Americans, young and middle aged and old. Unemployment simmers on the back burner.
Throw in a few teaspoons of lost hope and lost homes, and oversized privilege and wealth for a handful of people, and add a few drops of good old latent American racism. It is a recipe to make scapegoats of anyone else who does not look like or act like “us” and roll back all the progress of the past 50 years in racial justice and middle class economic opportunity. It’s a tea party!
Tuesday was the winter solstice. Each day forward lengthens with the sun’s light. Each day brings a little more hope than the previous. Many of us celebrate the birth of Jesus, a symbol of love, peace, generosity, hope and Christmas.
We have a choice: We can continue with the ongoing diminishment of our quality of life, and enable the undercurrents of racism to pull us apart even more. Or we can act on the good tidings of the season to realize a rebirth of justice, of hope, of progress, of brotherhood. Christmas is not just a parable from 2,000 years ago. It is a parable for us, for now.
John Burbank is executive director of the Economic Opportunity Institute (www.eoionline.org). His e-mail address is john@eoionline.org.

description.hltext_display: Banks maintain inflexible lending criteria
description.content:
Investec has warned that many people who accrue unconventional income through lump sum bonuses will struggle to get a mortgage by some less flexible banks.
According to Investec almost a third (32%) of IFAs say that their clients are expecting at least half of their bonus for the 2010/2011 tax year to be paid in cash or deferred cash with the remainder likely to be paid as shares or share options.
Investec says that FSA proposals that 50% of bank bonuses should be paid in shares, share-linked instruments or via equivalent non-cash routes, could make it more difficult for many of these individuals to secure large mortgage loans.
Whilst almost one in 10 (8%) of IFAs questioned said their clients are expecting their bonus to consist almost entirely (91-100%) of cash or deferred cash, a further 28% understand that cash will account for less than 10% of their clients’ bonus payments this year. Investec has warned that these individuals could be penalised when it comes to applying for large mortgage loans as many banks will look at the value of a clients’ property rather than their income and overall assets.
Jack Jones of Investec Specialist Private Bank said, “These findings show that while cash is still likely to feature bonus payments this year, many people will receive bonuses via non-cash routes such as shares or share-linked instruments. Although many of these individuals look set to receive significant bonuses, some will struggle to get mortgages and other personal loans approved due to the less flexible lending criteria adopted by some banks.”
Over three quarters (78%) of the IFAs surveyed say their clients are expecting to receive their bonus payment within a year or less, despite the forthcoming FSA regulation that will force those receiving a bonus, to defer up to 60% of it for three years or more. Investec believes that these results highlight the divergence in understanding between forthcoming industry regulation and the expectations of those due to receive bonuses.
Interestingly over a fifth (21%) of IFAs surveyed said that their clients have been discussing their financial plans with them earlier this year than in previous years. This is likely to be partly due to the introduction of a new 50% tax rate on incomes over £150,000, which starts from 1 January 2011.
Jack Jones continued, “We concentrate on the intricacies of a client’s finances in order to better understand their ‘true’ wealth, as opposed to taking the rigid stance adopted by many other lenders who remain focused on the property asset rather than the individual. We have the experience and expertise to structure a lending facility which accommodates their financial requirements.”

event_or_fact.property: while cash is still likely to feature bonus payments this year, many people will receive bonuses via non-cash routes such as shares or share-linked instruments.

description.hltext_display: Paris evacuated in plane weapon drama
description.content: PARIS Hilton has been evacuated from a Hawaii-bound flight after a knife was found on board the aircraft.The socialite was on a Delta plane en route to Maui from Los Angeles International Airport when a passenger found the four-inch serrated blade in a seat pocket, reports TMZ.The plane was later swept and deemed safe for reboarding.Officials for Delta later claimed that the knife was a box cutter which belonged to airline employees.

description.hltext_display: 中国“大城市病”蔓延 中小城市压力渐增(图)
description.content:
作者：simuba 来源：私募吧 发表时间：2010-12-21
” 由于中国一些大城市的“城市病”日益严重，何海军们不得不逃离“北上广（北京、上海、广州），到二三线城市寻求新发展。” 不仅如此，伴随着经济高速增长和城市规模扩大，“堵车”这一“大城市病”正快速由中国一线城市向二三线城市“传染”。....
财经宏观经济
2010-12-20 15:13:38来源: 新华网暂无网友评论
浏览字号：大中小 | 打印本页 | 通过Email推荐给好友：
“再不走，我这辈子恐怕真要打光棍了！”今年31岁的何海军在北京一家官方网站打拼了5年，经人介绍，他已相亲不下10次，尽管才貌俱佳，但对方得知他是个无房户后，最终都委婉地以“我们不合适”为由匆匆结束。
经历多次打击之后，何海军决定离开北京，投奔山东一家民营企业：“至少，那里生活压力相对小，幸福指数要高。”
由于中国一些大城市的“城市病”日益严重，何海军们不得不逃离“北上广（北京、上海、广州），到二三线城市寻求新发展。但有进入中小城市的人们发现，在这里也出现了“大城市病”的迹象。人口膨胀、交通拥挤、住房困难、环境恶化、资源紧张等“症状”已经开始向一些中小城市蔓延，有的地方还表现出加剧的趋势。
“这里的城市病越来越明显了！”3年前迫于生活压力，从上海回到家乡甘肃省兰州市的王盈盈满腹不解：“兰州怎么堵车也越来越厉害，而且冬季空气质量太差，今年入冬以来，已经有好几天是严重污染了。”
不仅如此，伴随着经济高速增长和城市规模扩大，“堵车”这一“大城市病”正快速由中国一线城市向二三线城市“传染”。
“中小城市堵车的速度一点也不亚于GDP增长速度。”在南京市一家药业公司工作的李凯说：“南京上班时间早晨六点半就开始堵，一些重点路段200米的路开车要走20分钟。‘大城市病’在这里传染得很快。”
刚刚从北京师范大学毕业的赵欣怡很不习惯乌鲁木齐没有自行车道：“自行车道已经全部被机动车挤占了，这里打的又很难，每天上下班只能坐公交车，很无奈。”
1 2 3 下一页

更多相关内容
财经宏观经济
2010-12-20 15:13:38来源: 新华网暂无网友评论
浏览字号：大中小 | 打印本页 | 通过Email推荐给好友：
除了交通堵塞之外，已经背负着一线城市高房价的中国人还发现，一些二三线城市逐渐出现了“一线房价”。“借钱也要先买套房子！”刚刚从北京回到西安的王辉说，“这里房价涨得这么快，得早下手。”
“看病难”在一些中小城市同样存在。乌鲁木齐市民王海英早晨5点起床后，便匆匆赶往新疆中医院排队挂专家号，而当地上班时间是上午10点。
“我去的时候已经有十几个人在排队了。”王海英说，5年前，乌鲁木齐不可能有这种情况，这几年人口增长太快了。
一些专家指出，近些年，中国经济社会的快速发展，人口向城市的快速集中，使城市、特别是大城市越来越不堪重负。当人们逃离大城市转向中小城市生活的时候，实际上同时也把大城市的压力转移到中小城市。一些中小城市复制或被传染了“大城市病”。对此，不少部门和专家已经表示，要警惕二三线城市患“大城市病”。
为了防止“大城市病”的重现，中国许多中小城市因地制宜探索了不少办法，“新城区”“老城区”“城市西扩”“市中心东移”等等，都是各地应对“大城市病”的努力与实践。
一些城市在反思“大城市病”的同时，开始追求“幸福指数”、“健康城市”、“绿色城市”，以减少“大城市病”的深度传染。

description.hltext_display: Ribuan Polisi Yogya Dikerahkan untuk Amankan Natal dan Tahun Baru
description.content:
TEMPO Interaktif, Yogyakarta - Untuk mengamankan perayaan Natal dan Tahun Baru 2011, Kepolisian Daerah Istimewa Yogyakarta menggelar Operasi Lilin Progo 2010 dengan menerjunkan 1.319 personil.
“Operasi Lilin Progo 2010 ini untuk pengamanan peringatan Natal dan perayaan menjelang tahun baru 2011,” kata Kepala Bidang Hubungan Masyarakat Keplosian Daerah (Polda) Daerah Istimewa Yogyakarta, Ajun Komisaris Besar Anny Pudjiastuti, Rabu (22/12).
Selain tempat ibadah, kata dia, operasi meliputi tempat lain untuk ibadah dan perayaan Natal, tempat perbelanjaan, pemukiman yang ditinggalkan pemilik dan pengamanan jalur-jalur masuk ke wilayah Daerah Istimewa Yogyakarta. Pengamanan yang diperketat juga termasuk tempat pemberhentian bus atau terminal dan stasiun kereta api.
Ditambahkan, penyisiran tempat ibadah umat Kristiani dilakukan oleh tim gabungan dari Brigade Mobil dengan tim Gegana untuk penjinak bom dan Satuan Samapta di masing masing Polres.
“Selain itu juga ada polisi pariwisata yang mangamankan lokasi wisata yang ramai dikunjungi warga,” kata Anny.
Selain pihak polisi yang berjaga di tempat ibadah Kristiani, eleman masyarakat, seperti Barisan Anshor Serbaguna yang disertakan. " Pengamanan selain terbuka juga ada yang tertutup. Ada yang berseragam ada yang tidak"ujarnya.

description.hltext_display: UK puts its SAS choppers on terror alert
description.content:
The British Government and top army commanders have decided to put the country's crack SAS helicopters on a state of high alert to crush any Christmas terror attack.
Chinooks and Pumas were moved to the elite unit's Hereford headquarters when fears of a Mumbai-style attack in the UK first emerged, The Sun reports.rmy bosses put a "substantial" number of the Who Dares Wins soldiers on round-the-clock standby - set to go at a moment's notice. All other duties and exercises were cancelled.
The alert is the most telling proof yet of how seriously anti-terror bosses are taking the nightmare threat of a "spectacular" attack.
The standby order has been confirmed by senior military sources.
Meanwhile, British Home Secretary Theresa May has urged the country's citizens to be vigilant.
The official terror threat level is "severe" meaning an attack is likely. (ANI)
Have your say on this story

description.hltext_display: Fans Fill Amway Center To See New Magic Players
description.content:
ORLANDO, Fla. -- Despite a loss against the Maverick, a cautious hope spread across Orlando Magic fans who packed the Amway Center on Tuesday night.
The Amway Center broke a record, with 19,057 fans filing through the doors to watch the Magic play at home with almost a whole new team. The new arena helped bring in a lot of fans, but will they trades help them stick around? All the change has a lot of people nervous.
Mindy King and her friend walked into the game talking about what the trades mean for Orlando.
"I think they probably do need a little bit of fresh blood in there and I like Turkoglu," she said. "I think there's a big following for Turkoglu."
Joe Victor agreed and said, "I think its awesome. I think its a great move. I think bringing Turkoglu here is phenomenal."
Meanwhile, other fans are nervous about losing Rashard Lewis and Vince Carter.
"I'm worried," said Anthony Parnell. "I loved Vince Carter."
"I'm not real happy about Rashard," said Betty Wallace. "Too early to tell. Gilbert Arenas, not one of my favorites."
But by the end of the game, many fans walked out with more than a glimmer of hope. The Magic lost 105-99, but they're hoping the team can make things click before playoffs.
Parnell said, "They really do have to gel. We can't expect it overnight, right?"

event_or_fact.property: I think its awesome.; I think its a great move. I think bringing Turkoglu here is phenomenal.
I think they probably do need a little bit of fresh blood in there and I like Turkoglu; I think there's a big following for Turkoglu.
They really do have to gel.
I'm not real happy about Rashard

description.hltext_display: Blotter: $9,740 fraudulently transferred from Saratogan's bank account
description.content:
Compiled from officers of the Santa Clara County Sheriff's Department's Westside Substation.
Identity theft--On Dec. 10 at 7:30 a.m. An unknown person used a victim's personal information on the Internet to transfer money from the victim's bank account to an unidentified account for a total loss of $9,740.
Suspended license--On Dec. 9 at 3:15 p.m. at Homes Drive and Cox Avenue. Deputies stopped a vehicle due to a traffic violation. The driver provided a false name. Deputies learned that the driver had a suspended license and did not have a required ignition lock device.
Petty theft--On Dec. 8 on Fruitvale Avenue. An unknown person entered a home using an unknown method. A ring, worth $150, was taken.
False registration tabs--On Dec. 7 at 10:24 p.m. at Quito Road and Bucknall Road. A vehicle was stopped for a traffic violation. The vehicle was found to have false registration tabs. The driver was cited and released.
Grand theft--On Dec. 7 at 2:33 p.m. on Devon Avenue. A purse containing a cell phone, cash and credit cards, was stolen from a vehicle. The total loss was estimated at $1,009.
Possession of an imitation weapon--On Dec. 7 at 4:37 p.m. on Saratoga Avenue. Deputies responded to a disturbance at the Saratoga Library. The deputies found that someone was in possession of a fake weapon. The person was cited and released.

description.hltext_display: Commentary: There's nothing that says Merry Christmas like a box of See's candy, and a root canal
description.author: Dick Sparrer
description.content:
It wasn't exactly what I wanted for Christmas.
In fact, I didn't want one for my birthday, Valentine's Day or any other day of the year, for that matter.
But teeth know no holidays, so when the need arises for a root canal, there's no getting around it--no matter what time of the year it is.
And it was just a few years back that I needed a root canal "... just a few days before Christmas.
Actually, it was a Christmas experience that precipitated the entire endodontic episode. In simple terms, I was chomping a caramel chew out of a box of See's candy someone had given my wife as an early Christmas present and I yanked a gold crown right off of my tooth.
"Better call the dentist!" said my wife with something of a sadistic smile. She wasn't at all sympathetic (considering that she had warned me to stay out of her candy!).
"No, I think I can put it back on myself," I said.
"Don't be gross!" said my youngest son.
"I'm not," I said defensively. "I can get something at the drug store and stick it back on."
So that's just what I did. I picked up some dental adhesive at the store, and the crown stayed firmly in place--right up until dinner that night. It popped off again with a mouthful of pork roast.
"That's really gross!" groaned my son.
"He's right, that is gross," said my wife. "That's it--I'm calling the dentist first thing in the morning."
She did, and I'm not sureyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); I'll ever forgive her for it.
"They can take you on Wednesday," she announced the next day. "Right after work."
Great. Not only was she sending me to the dentist, but I wouldn't even get to miss work in the process. At least I could take consolation in the knowledge that I was just getting a crown replaced. Or so I thought at the time.
Now, the dentist's office is a remarkable place. It looks friendly enough from the outside, what with all of the Christmas decorations and the magazines and comfortable waiting room. They have the dens of pain with their tools of torture cleverly hidden from the unsuspecting dupes who walk through the front door.
And I had to be the biggest dupe of all as I slid into the dentist's chair with my crown neatly tucked away in a tissue in my hand.
"Hello, Richard," said the dentist (he calls me Richard because that's the name on the insurance policy that he planned to suck dry right along with all of the fluid in my mouth). "What seems to be the problem?"
"My crown popped off," I said naively, handing him the tissue, "and I need it put back on."
He smiled a knowing smile as he peeled away the tissue to reveal the gold treasure inside, and he said, "Well, we'll see."
Three X-rays later, he gave me the bad news.
"It looks like you need a root canal," he said. (Translation: "It looks like you need to make the next payment on my Mercedes.") And with that he was jabbing me with enough shots of Novocain to drop a baby elephant.
"Are we numb?" he asked. Since my tongue felt about the size of a throw pillow, I didn't even try to speak and just nodded.
Then he fired up the drill.
(You know, I'm convinced that those Christmas cards hanging in the waiting room were fakes and not from happy patients at all!)
Now, there's nothing quite as torturous as the sound of a drill grinding away a tooth's enamel--unless, of course, it's that same drill hitting a piece of the nerve not yet dulled by the Novocain. "Is that part still sensitive?" he asked.
"Oh, yeah! What gave it away? The fact that every muscle in my body tensed up and I jumped a foot and a half out of the chair!?!" That's what I wanted to say. But all I could get out was, "Argghh, oomph."
"Well, what we'll have to do now "... "
He started to explain the procedure.
" "... is to numb you a little more "... "
I don't want to hear this!
" "... by giving you another shot "... "
Please, just do it, and don't explain the "...
" "... right into the open cavity in the tooth."
Great. Like that was something I really needed to know. Why couldn't he just do what he had to do, and leave me to my imagination?
"And it's going to be a little uncomfortable."
Fine. There's another piece of information I didn't really need.
It was most definitely uncomfortable, as was the entire process that followed. But thankfully, about a half hour later I was through with it.
"That's it," he announced, along with other information and pleasantries, then he sent me on my way with a jolly, "Merry Christmas!"
"Muwwy Cwusmus," I muttered back through Novocain-deadened lips.
It sure wasn't the most pleasant Christmas experience I ever had, but at least I could chew again.
And I'm reminded of that painful experience by the sight of another box of See's candy sitting under the Christmas tree this year with Natalie's name on it. But I won't make that mistake of a few years back against this year. I learned an important lesson that Christmas--stay away from the chocolate chews and stick with the creams!
Merry Christmas to all, and to all a good bite!
Contact Dick Sparrer at dsparrer@community-newspapers.com.

description.hltext_display: Hairstyle and face shape
description.content: How to choose a hairstyle? If a woman wants to change, she changes her hairstyle. And not to be disappointments because of damaged hair, it is necessary to think over in advance. : Choosing hairstyles, which is the most effective manner emphasize the natural beauty of its owner, depends on the shape of the face. Each person (and each haircut) has a unique individuality.However, among professionals is customary to distinguish five main types of forms the female face.OvalA person has a slightly elongated shape, it has no protruding parts. For this type is characterized by uniform proportions, smooth jaw line, chin and forehead. This type is considered the standard (although there is no reason to consider other types of faces something worse). Owners of an oval face suit all kinds of hairstyles. They can successfully keep changing image. Oval type of persons are Sharon Stone, Jennifer Aniston, Linda Evangelista, Monica Bellucci.CircleSigns of the round faces: chubby cheeks, chin, small, soft facial features. A spokeswoman for round face shapes are Christina Ricci, Kirsten Dunst. Owners http://www.flanmark.com of this type of person is not fluffy hair, which creates unwanted additional volume. Small curls and do not fit. Thick bangs will create the effect of "weighting" of the lower face. "Licked" her hair, too, will not improve the picture. Braids, parted in the middle - is not the best option.The ideal type of hairstyle for round face shape - asymmetric with ragged edges. Strands that falls on the cheeks, conceal their roundness. The mobility of the hair to add dynamics. It successfully compensates for a certain lack of focus, which is characteristic for a round-type person. A good solution would be truncated, asymmetric bangs to one side, long hair, who cut short ladder at the border with the person.Square or rectangleCharacteristics: a wide jaw and forehead. This type of face have many famous women, including those recognized by the beauty of Hollywood (Paris Hilton, Katie Holmes, Demi Moore, Gwyneth Paltrow), our famous Ksenia Sobchak and Tina Kandelaki.Least of all for a square or rectangular face goes straight and sleek hair, thick straight bangs, straight hair. Best for this type - the lush hair styling, creating waves and curls, asymmetrical haircuts. For example, bulk hair, side parting very soften facial features, make it visually oval.HeartFor a person of this type is characterized by a broad forehead and chin - a narrow and sharp. Do owners of a good looking person in the form of "heart" often have dimples and "women's fashion " is now prominent cheekbones. For this type is better not to create a volume from the top or upsweep hair behind her ears. Not the best option - haircut "boyish" or fleece from forehead to crown with smooth sides. Choose hairstyles FLANMARK.com with a focus below the cheekbones, bang - a thick, asymmetric with irregular edges.Examples of good hair: graded haircut, complete with scythe bangs, asymmetrical bob with a long lock of hair from one side of the face.TrapezeSigns: a narrow forehead and jaw - is wide. Among the owners of a person trapezoid - Angelina Jolie, Sandra Bullock. For this type of worst fit short haircuts and styling, opening the brow and ears, straight hair. Mitigate the heavy lower face may long hair, side parting, curls, voluminous stowage. Example of a successful hair - surround a square to the shoulders, the ends of hair smoothly trimmed, asymmetrical styling.

description.hltext_display: Polda Akan Evaluasi Kondisi Peralatan Terjun Payung
description.content:
Bripda Lahsan Tanjani, penerjun payung yang jatuh di atas genting rumah di Tangerang Selatan, Banten (20/12). ANTARA/Muhammad Deffa
TEMPO Interaktif, Jakarta - Kepolisian Daerah Metro Jaya akan mengevaluasi peralatan yang dimiliki, termasuk peralatan yang digunakan untuk terjun payung. Hal itu dilakukan untuk mengantisipasi terulangnya peristiwa serupa saat seorang anggota Brimob Kelapa Dua, Lahsan Tanjung jatuh saat terjun di Ciputat, Tangerang beberapa waktu lalu.
“Akan kami evaluasi terhadap semua peralatan yang ada. Setiap kecelakaan pasti kami evaluasi dari semua aspek,” kata Kapolda Metro Jaya, Inspektur Jenderal Sutarman di Mapolda Metro Jaya, Rabu (22/12).
Menurut Sutarman, ada tiga faktor yang harus dipperhatikan agar peristiwa serupa tidak terulang, yaitu kondisi peralata, kejelian dalam mengecek peralatan dan keterampilan anggota penerjun. “Sebagus apapun peralatan, jika tidak dirawat akan tetap menjadi masalah,” kata mantan Kapolda Jawa Barat itu lagi.
Pengecekan sebelum terjun, menurutnya juga menjadi hal yang penting dilakukan agar terhindar dari kecelakaan. “Semua harus dicek supaya kemungkinan terburuk bisa diminimalisir,” ujarnya.
Lebih lanjut, ujar Sutarman, setiap penerjun harus membekali diri dengan pengetahuan seputar prosedur penerjunan seperti faktor keselamatan. Ia mencontohkan, saat melakukan terjun payung, penerjuan harus mengecek peralatan apakah sudah tergulung dengan benar dan bisa berkembang dengan baik. Kemudian, tambahnya, penerjun harus mengerti langkah dalam melakukan penerjunan, mulai dari melepas payung pertama sampai melepas payung cadangan. “Penerjun harus tahu prosedur keselamatan itu, apa yang harus dilakukan jika payung tidak mengembang,” kata Sutarman.

description.hltext_display: Commentary: For those who ride the waves, surfing is a sort of religion
description.author: Carl Heintze
description.content:
A current novel much read--it's a selection of Silicon Valley Reads--is The Year of Fog by Michelle Richmond, a San Francisco creative writing teacher.
It tells the story of a San Francisco woman, a photographer who is walking on the beach with her prospective husband's daughter, 8, in the fog when the photographer is momentarily distracted by the sight of a dead seal. When she abandons the seal, the daughter has disappeared. The rest of the book is about trying to find the missing daughter.
I won't give away the plot except to say that in the end the narrator-heroine finds solace in surfing. I stack that conclusion up with a list of books which explore what I call the mysticism is surfing. For those who participate in the sport, it often seems to become a sort of religion.
In searching for the perfect wave, surfers tend to become dedicated to the ocean, the waves, their boards and their fellows.
Since I am not a surfer, I should not try to define the perfect wave. But I think it is one that breaks in a direction away from the surfer so he or she can insert himself or herself in the "tube" and, surrounded by water in motion, ride for what seems an endless distance wrapped in this circle, perhaps into Nirvanaor at least to near the shore.
If I have this wrong, forgive me, surfers.
The search for the perfect wave--seldom if ever found--can take on global proportions. It is, in fact, the subjectyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); of a famous movie, The Endless Summer.
The protagonists in the movie circle the Earth, stopping in selected places to sample the surf and sand in search of the perfect wave. I can't remember if they find it or not. Suffice it to say most surfers are still searching for the perfect wave, even as Christians, Muslims, Jews, Hindus and perhaps even Scientologists are seeking a perfect world based on their faith that such is possible. They just don't necessarily do it at the beach.
Surfing, which as near as I can tell originated in Hawaii, goes back in Polynesian history a long way, but it really didn't blossom on the mainland until the 1950s or thereabouts, when it became a raging fever in Southern California.
The reason is pretty obvious. It takes warm waters and fair skies to bring surfers to the sea. That and, of course, waves, but waves that are not too high. Just perfect.
When this happy combination of water, wind, sun and wave coincide, surfers are in some kind of heaven. They sit on the beach in a trance, staring at the sea and looking at the waves, seeking just the right one.
Numerous authors have been bewitched by this dedication to the ocean. One of the first in the last century was the late Eugene Burdick, also author of The Ugly American and Fail Safe, who wrote of surfing in one of his earliest novels, The Ninth Wave. In it he managed to mix surfing and politics, among other things. Since then others, including Mrs. Richmond, have depended on the beach and the surf and the waves for their milieu.
I have long speculated as to why this is so. Now and then I used to quiz my two former sons-in-law, both of whom were surfers. They could never give me coherent reasons for their dedication to the waves. Neither of them, now in middle life, surf anymore, and their dedication seems in retrospect to be more to their sport than it was to any religious feeling.
They did make me aware, though, that at the time they were surfing, it was mostly a male endeavor and they looked with disfavor, even disdain, on female surfers. Females were supposed to sit on the beach, as I got it, and wait for the male surfers to come ashore.
I gather that view of surfing has changed somewhat and that there are now female as well as male surfers, though just how numerous they are is uncertain.
In Mrs. Richmond's novel the heroine meets a woman surfer named Goofy who teaches her how to "get up" and presumably launches her into a surfing Nirvana of some kind. I'm not sure how much of a Nirvana this may be since the surfing is done around the San Francisco Bay Area, where the water is pretty cold. Most Northern California surfers are forced to use wetsuits to keep warm.
Warm or cold, most of Mrs. Richmond's novel takes place at or near the beach--as any good surfer would require--and her prose does bring to life the feel of the sand, the sight of the sea and the smell of the fog that falls with great regularity on Ocean Beach near the Cliffhouse.
And that's where the opening and closing scenes of the novel seem, fittingly, to be. Carl Heintze can be reached at carlheintze@juno.com.

description.hltext_display: LVMH erhöht Beteiligung an Hermes International weiter
description.content:
Paris (aktiencheck.de AG) - Der französische Luxusgüterkonzern LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton S.A. (ISIN FR0000121014 / WKN 853292) gab am Dienstag bekannt, dass er seine Beteiligung an dem heimischen Wettbewerber Hermes International S.A. (ISIN FR0000052292 / WKN 886670) weiter erhöht hat.
Den Angaben zufolge hält LVMH nun mehr als 20 Prozent an Hermes, was rund 21,3 Millionen Anteilsscheinen entspricht. Zuletzt hatte LVMH seine Beteiligung von unter 5 Prozent auf 14,2 Prozent und dann weiter auf 17,1 Prozent erhöht.
Wie LVMH Ende Oktober mitteilte, strebt man nicht an, bei Hermes die Kontrolle zu übernehmen oder einen Sitz im Board zu erhalten.
Die Aktie von LVMH schloss gestern in Paris bei 125,45 Euro (+1,66 Prozent). (22.12.2010/ac/n/a)

description.hltext_display: Commentary: Moore still in there pitching--horseshoes, that is
description.author: Mary Ann Cook
description.content:
HORSESHOE-PITCHING CHAMPION: You never know what bright stars may be just around the corner when you live in Saratoga. Take, for example, soft-spoken Leon Moore, the California champion in the venerable art of horseshoe pitching.
Strictly speaking, we need to use the past tense since Moore, 78, was recently dethroned. He earned the title for 2009, but declined to compete this year, citing Bakersfield heat. In the over-70 competition, contestants can pitch from a distance of 30 feet, rather than the 40 for younger competitors.
Moore grew up on an Oklahoma farm, where horseshoe pitching was standard recreation. The schoolyard had a court.
Actually, you could say Moore's been in missile projection most of his life. After earning a degree in mechanical engineering, he went to work in the missile program, first for GM, then at Lockheed for 37 years.
Horseshoes took a back seat during those years, and he didn't pitch regularly until he retired. Moore's late wife Ann was a doctor of physical and medical rehabilitation. When he first asked her out (at his sister-in-law's suggestion) he went to the clinic where she worked, and the doctor-to-be took his blood pressure. See what I mean about soft-spoken?
They managed to sort out his original intention and took it from there. These days Leon is a member of the San Jose Horseshoe Club which meets at Columbus Park near the airport. What does it take to become a horseshoeyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); champion? The word from the champ: practice.
TIT FOR TAT: When the members of the Saratoga High football team came to call on Brenda Kashuba of the 4EverFit Personal Training Studio, she couldn't resist, so struck was she by their manners and enthusiasm. The team travels in groups and in uniform for these sponsorship pleas and she was so impressed she's been sponsoring the frosh-soph team for the past two years.
The mother of two boys herself, she says, "I had to hand it to the boys for going out and pounding the pavement to ask for support--that's awesome!" And as a small Saratoga business owner she likes to support schools and other nonprofits. Kashuba also heads up local fundraisers, the most recent being the Eric Drew Foundation's Trek for Treatments.
She was counting on 40 volunteers from Monta Vista High, but a week before the event she learned the club would fall far short of its past involvement. Desperate, she contacted Tina Johnson, a Saratoga Falcons mom, who put out a plea to all the other football parents. Twelve players answered the call and were put to work.
They loaded and unloaded supplies, served food, passed out brochures and set up booths. Ultimately, Monta Vista also rallied several last-minute helpers and the rek ended up a major success for the foundation. Funds raised are used to find ameliorating treatments for those terminally ill and help support their families.
"It's so cool that we have a chance to support someone that supports Falcon football, and it's because our players got involved in the fundraising," said Tina Johnson.
HONOREE: Los Gatan Helen Gaetano was recently honored for 40 years of service to the Republican Women, including eight years as president. She received a plaque naming her president emeritus of the Silicon Valley Association of Republican Women. Helen has run fashion shows, sponsored speakers and even tap danced for one event.
A tireless worker, she volunteers at Los Gatos' El Camino Hospital, too. Her husband, Al, was also honored. This year's charity for SVARW is City on the Hill, a model legislature program for youth. Students are selected through an essay contest now in progress at rdwales@earthlink.net.
Officers installed were Cathy Davis, president; Martha Snodgrass, v.p.; Allison Spiller, second v.p.; Janet Nedde, secretary; Lisa Seago, corresponding secretary; and Debra Janssen-Martinez, treasurer.
COOKIE MASTERS: These 23 cookie masters got together for a holiday exchange for the 23rd year, this time at Joyce Malia's home. Most of them met when they were physical and occupational therapists at Valley Med more than 20 years ago. And one of their number is Audrey Vaggione of Dolce Bella Chocolates, now located at the Chocolate Cafe in Westgate.
Is it safe to say she won the annual prize awarded to the cookie with the highest chocolate content? Cookie maker Dawn Graeme's husband Randy is a Bearitone, those melodic alums of UC-Berkeley, and the Bearitones again serenaded the cooks. Vic Ulmer is also a Bearitone. The farthest afield cook was Tiiu Talva from Honolulu.
Got a tip for Saratoga Sampler? E-mail mac@impruve.com or call 408.540.7977.

description.hltext_display: 风电扎堆上市 保险或迎新好时代
description.content:
作者：simuba 来源：私募吧 发表时间：2010-12-21
以英大财险为例，其目前已经承保了中国风电集团有限公司、黑龙江华富风力发电有限公司和中水电中电风力发电有限公司等旗下十余家子公司的一切险和机损险。事实上，上述风险管控措施基本上所有开展风电保险业务的公司都有相关设计，但根据中国风电保险市场上已有的少数案....
尽管所有利益相关方都强调，过去几年倒下的约十台风机只是小概率事件，但经历了近四年风驰电掣般的飞速发展后，中国风电不得不回头审视过去可能埋下的“隐形炸弹”。
不过，当众多风电设备厂商们痛苦的“回头”后，他们所见的并不仅是风机的故障问题，还有一张张明媚的笑脸。这些笑脸来自于国内开展了风电保险业务的保险公司。
实际上，因为今年风电企业扎堆上市的热潮，越来越多的设备厂商开始考虑寻找金融资本的庇佑，以求在遇到质量风险后能够确保财务的平滑。
而在部分风电企业们还在权衡是否出手购买保险之时，始于今年11月，国家能源局启动的针对风电装备质量问题的专项调查，无疑是帮助保险公司们增大了业务拓展的可能。
“专项调查让人们不禁想象，中国风机的质量问题确实很大。”一位投行人士向本报记者表示，“那么，投资者便会格外重视企业是否具有完善的风险转移措施。”
据了解，风电保险在欧美国家已经是相对成熟的险种，即使在我国也并不是全新的话题，但却绝对称得上“冷门”。然而，上述投行人士认为，中国风电保险业务的好时代或许正在来临。
事实上，对于保险公司来说，这项新开辟的业务也有可能是一块“烫手的山芋”，“开展这部分业务最后到底是盈是亏，目前我们还看不清楚。”英大泰和财产保险股份有限公司（下称英大财险）产品精算部一位负责人坦言。
保险费率0.3‰-0.5‰
2008年10月28日获准开业的英大财险在保险行业中资历尚浅，但由于股东的电力行业背景，其在开展电力保险业务时具有天然的渠道优势。据了解，英大财险已于去年正式启动风电保险业务。
前述英大财险产品精算部负责人介绍，按照投保人的不同，目前的风电产品分为两大类：一类是针对设备制造商，在生产和运输环节分别设计了产品质量保证保险（下称质保险）和货运险；另一类则是针对发电企业在运营期间的财产一切险（下称一切险）和机器损坏险（下称机损险）。
“火电一直都在上保险，所以在火电业主投资风电的时候，对于保险也是很关注的。”金丰（北京）保险经纪有限公司总经理助理张文杰表示。
他介绍，在五大发电集团的内部财务管理规定上，也有明确的保险工作内容要求，因此，我国实际运营的风电场中，已经投保的并不在少数。
以英大财险为例，其目前已经承保了中国风电集团有限公司、黑龙江华富风力发电有限公司和中水电中电风力发电有限公司等旗下十余家子公司的一切险和机损险。
而设备商的投保案例则相对有限。“我们的第一单，是最近和今年10月在美国上市的某风电设备企业签订的保险合同。此外，则是正在和东方汽轮机有限公司（下称东汽）洽谈合作事宜。”上述英大财险产品精算部负责人透露。
他表示，目前有风电设备生产商这样的客户基础，主要是风电企业现在面临着较大的风险状况，转嫁风险的意愿比较强烈。所以，保险公司在设计风机质保险时，会比其他产品的同类险种更加细化。
“以我们与风电设备企业的合作为例，风机保险分为海上和陆上机组。”这位负责人介绍，因为设备所处的环境不同、面临的风险也不一样，所以制定的费率就有区别。“目前来看，风电保险的费率更高，海上机组的费率要比陆上再高50%。”
“国内的保险费率约为0.3‰-0.5‰，高于火电和水电。”张文杰对记者表示，这个价格实际上还不足欧洲定价的1/10，“欧洲普遍为7‰左右。”
但上述来自英大财险人士表示，即使这样的费率水平，也往往要经过艰苦的谈判。他透露，以现有的投保案例来看，整机倒掉的情况还是少见。但因为是高空安装作业，风电设备遭遇磕碰等意外的出险率比火电和水电要高很多，而对这样“小毛病”的赔偿额可能让保险公司吃不消。“一个零部件的成本可能只是2万-3万，但是吊装成本可能上百万。”

description.hltext_display: '3G in India: Operator Launch Strategies' and Other Research Reports by Ovum Available at MarketPublishers.com
FCC Adopts New Rules To Protect Web Traffic
description.content:
WASHINGTON -- A divided Federal Communications Commission has approved new rules meant to prohibit broadband companies from interfering with Internet traffic flowing to their customers.
The 3-2 vote Tuesday marks a major victory for FCC Chairman Julius Genachowski, who has spent more than a year trying to craft a compromise.
The FCC's three Democrats voted to pass the rules, while the two Republicans opposed them, arguing that they amount to unnecessary regulation. The new rules are likely to face intense scrutiny on Capitol Hill once Republicans take over the House. Meanwhile, public interest groups decried the regulations as too weak, particularly for wireless systems.
Known as "net neutrality," the rules prohibit phone and cable companies from favoring or discriminating against Internet content and services, such as those from rivals.

description.hltext_display: Westmont's Talley is named division's Senior of the Year
description.author: Kevin Sparrer, for Silicon Valley Community Newspapers
description.content:
By Kevin Sparrer, for Silicon Valley Community Newspapers
Chantel Talley stood tall at the net for Westmont's girls volleyball team this fall, and the rest of the league took notice.
Talley recorded 55 blocks for the Warriors this year, helping them to a third-place finish in the Mt. Hamilton Division of the Blossom Valley Athletic League with a record of 11-3 in league, 23-12 overall. Talley did so well that the league's coaches named her the Senior of the Year. Talley also helped her squad with 100 kills.
Westmont's Maria Tayoan received the Most Defensive Player award. Tayoan led her team with 212 digs and 217 serves received.
Gabi Cinkova from Live Oak earned the Most Valuable Player award, Natalie Fahey of Willow Glen received the Junior of the Year award and Fa Saulala of Live Oak was the Sophomore of the Year.
Westmont junior Valerie Evans was named first team all-league and led the Warriors with 196 kills this year, while junior Kelly Takacs earned second team all-league honors with 254 assists, 25 blocks and 74 kills.
The rest of the members of the all-league first team included Alyssa Brusachetti and Alli Unger of Live Oak, Marina Bozinovic and Felicia Spadafore of Willow Glen, Kaitlyn Pickey of Leigh, Courtney Krail of Leland and Raquel Orosa of Evergreen Valley.
The other players named second team all-league were Katie Obbema and Allison Shedden of Live Oak, Ashley Wormath of Willow Glen, Elyse Eitel of Leigh, Courtney Lam of Evergreen Valley, Allison Clark of Lelandyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); and Amanda Daysog of Mt. Pleasant. Senior Nicky Klug earned a first team all-league position for Prospect this year in the Santa Teresa Division of the BVAL. Klug helped her team to a third-place finish with a record of 6-5 in league, 8-11 overall.
Senior Lydia Ku earned a second team all-league spot for the Panthers.
Melissa Erezo of Silver Creek earned the MVP award, while Katherine Ja was named the Senior of the Year for Silver Creek. Oak Grove's Mishel Deemer received the Junior of the Year award, Cassidy Sanders-Curry was named the Sophomore of the Year for Santa Teresa and Lincoln's Sydney Thompson was honored with the Freshman of the Year award.
The rest of the first team all-league awards went to Kayla McElvy of Sobrato, Cassidy Sanders-Curry of Santa Teresa, Nina Bradley of Lincoln, Caitlin Trageser and Dianne Lim of Oak Grove and Tylyn Santos and Chioma Nwiuzi of Silver Creek.
The other members of the second team all-league were Jennifer Cordena of Piedmont Hills, Emily Kyle of Sobrato, Morgan Messick of Santa Teresa, Lucila Chavez of Lincoln, Misa Wong of Pioneer, Brook Morgan of Oak Grove and Amy Wong of Silver Creek.

description.hltext_display: 4SC erhält EU-Fördermittel
description.content:
Martinsried (aktiencheck.de AG) - Das Biotech-Unternehmen 4SC AG erhält als Teil eines Konsortiums EU-Fördermittel zur Identifizierung neuer Wirkstoffe für die Behandlung von Rheumatoider Arthritis.
Unternehmensangaben vom Mittwoch zufolge unterstützt die Europäische Union das Konsortium zur Erforschung des Zusammenhangs zwischen periodontalen
Erkrankungen und Rheumatoider Arthritis (RA) mit 5,8 Mio. Euro. Ziel sei die Entwicklung selektiver niedermolekulare Hemmer von Proteinen, die für die Auslösung der zu RA führenden Autoimmunreaktionen verantwortlich sind. Die erfolgreiche Identifizierung neuer Inhibitoren ermögliche die Entwicklung einer neuen
Generation von Medikamenten, mit denen sich RA vermeiden und in frühen
Stadien nach Ausbruch der Krankheit behandeln lässt.
RA ist eine chronisch entzündliche Gelenkerkrankung. Bei den Ursachen von RA können neben genetischen auch autoimmune Faktoren eine Rolle spielen. Es mehren sich die Hinweise, dass eine Autoimmunität durch Infektionserreger, wie sie beispielsweise bei periodontalen Erkrankungen auftreten, ausgelöst werden kann. Das Projekt soll dem Verständnis über mechanistische Zusammenhänge zwischen diesen beiden Krankheiten dienen, hieß es weiter.
Die Aktie von 4SC fiel zuletzt um 2,94 Prozent auf 3,27 Euro. (22.12.2010/ac/n/nw)

description.hltext_display: 午后：美元走强 美股涨跌不一
description.content:
作者：simuba 来源：私募吧 发表时间：2010-12-21
美东时间12月20日12:45(北京时间12月21日01:45)，道琼斯工业平均指数下跌20.17点，报11,471.74点，跌幅0.18%；纳斯达克综合指数上涨3.90点，报2,646.87点，涨幅0.15%；标准普尔500指数上涨2.47点，报1,246.38点，涨幅0.20%。....
新浪财经讯 北京时间12月21日凌晨消息，美国股市周一午后涨跌不一。美元汇率走强，原油期货价格下跌，金价止跌返涨。
美东时间12月20日12:45(北京时间12月21日01:45)，道琼斯工业平均指数下跌20.17点，报11,471.74点，跌幅0.18%；纳斯达克综合指数上涨3.90点，报2,646.87点，涨幅0.15%；标准普尔500指数上涨2.47点，报1,246.38点，涨幅0.20%。
道指上周上涨了0.7%，并已连续三周上涨。今年至今道指已经已经上涨了超过10%。
道指30种工业成分股当中，有18只股票下跌。波音(BA)下跌了2.7%，原因是市场担心该公司将再度推迟787梦幻客机的交付时间。
芯片生产商英特尔(INTC)下跌了1%，此前《华尔街日报》报道称，欧洲监管机构正在评估英特尔提出的收购McAfee Inc要约。
美国运通(AXP)股价大跌5.8%。
外汇市场中，美元汇率走强，追踪美元兑其它6种主要货币汇率的美元指数升至80.68点，盘中一度创两周新高。美元兑欧元汇率升至两周新高，此前欧洲央行表示上周收购的欧洲政府债券数量大幅降低。
黄金期货价格止跌转涨，2月交割的金价上涨了4.50美元，涨幅0.3%，报每盎司1383.70美元，盘中最高曾上涨至1,388.90美元。原油期货价格下跌。
尽管朝鲜半岛的紧张局势再次升级，但周一美国股市仍然小幅高开，力图延续此前三周连续上涨势头。据媒体报道，韩国周一在距离朝韩两国边界不远的延坪岛进行实弹演习，导致南北关系趋紧。
投资机构Cantor Fitzgerald美国市场分析师马克-帕多(Marc Pado)认为，由于上市公司第四季度业绩十分强劲，股市尽管在短期超买，但涨势仍有望延续到明年1月份。
帕多表示，“毫无疑问，市场已经超买，但驱动市场上涨的动力是上市公司的业绩，圣诞节行情值得期待。”
本周五金融市场将因为圣诞节而休市。(张俊)

description.hltext_display: Bagdasarian, Camburn top all-league list
description.author: Mike Barnhart, for Silicon Valley Community Newspapers
description.content:
By Mike Barnhart, for Silicon Valley Community Newspapers
Alex Bagdasarian of Monta Vista and Daniel Camburn of Homestead caused a lot of problems for other Santa Clara Valley Athletic League De Anza Division water polo teams during the fall season.
Bagdasarian was a key "go-to" player and leader for Monta Vista, which claimed second place in the division and reached the Central Coast Section playoffs for the first time in several seasons. Camburn and senior teammate Joey Schaadt were double trouble for opponents, accounting for most of Homestead's offense. The three seniors were among the 15 players named to the De Anza Division all-league water polo first team by division coaches recently.
Bagdasarian was joined on the all-league first team by senior teammates Andrew Sabour, the Most Valuable Goalie, Sean Hughes and Nick Sinzig. Monta Vista junior Cameron Yates received honorable mention, as did Homestead senior Scott Connolly.
Lynbrook senior Connor Brunmeier shared El Camino Division Most Valuable Player honors with Wilcox senior Nico Cabrera. Brunmeier was joined on the all-El Camino first team by senior teammates Vikram Kanth, the Most Valuable Goalie, Evan Shieh and Nick Lorenzen.
Other first-team choices included Wilcox seniors Tyler Meeken, Rob Rebholts and Randy Simonin, the Fremont brother combination of senior Ryan Kashi and sophomore Alex Kashi, Scott Vershup of Cupertino, Saratoga teammates Steven Cho and Tyler Borch and the Harker trio of Chris Ng, Rex Chen and Karanyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); Das-Grande.
Fremont sophomore Isaac Allen and Wilcox juniors Lee McBride and James Harsh were tabbed honorable mention, along with Rishabh Hegde of Lynbrook and Akshay Ramachandran of Harker. Lynbrook, which used a balanced attack to win the El Camino Division championship and earn a Central Coast Section play-off berth, placed three players on the division's all-league first team--sophomores Emily Fong and Natalie Popescu and senior Caroline Diehl.
The Most Valuable Player was Wilcox senior Savannah Seaman and the Most Valuable Goalie was senior Olivia Lang of Cupertino.
Other first team selections included Fremont seniors Rachael Nakagawa and Sarah McKee, Wilcox seniors Megan Brown and Sierra Dias and junior teammate Karlee Fidler, Cupertino senior Yuri Ujifusa and Harker sophomore Keri Clifford.
Second team choices included Lynbrook seniors Emmeline Tsen and Ashley Tsai and Fremont seniors Arielle Swan-Smith and Annie Paul.
Seniors Barbara Spyrou of Homestead, Nicole Danese of Monta Vista and Allison Buchanan of Saratoga were first team picks in the De Anza Division, which featured seven players from champion Los Altos on the honors list. Monta Vista senior Sonika Singh and Homestead junior Allis Yao were second-team selections.

description.hltext_display: Radioactive dump laws given thumbs up
description.content:
Draft laws for a radioactive waste dump in Australia have been given the thumbs up by a federal parliamentary committee.Energy Minister Martin Ferguson introduced the laws to parliament earlier this year, saying they would ensure the safe management of medical, industrial and research radioactive material.
The laws will allow a site to be established anywhere in Australia rather than just the Northern Territory, overriding state and territory laws.
A parliamentary committee looking into the laws on Wednesday released a report recommending they be passed by federal parliament.
Muckaty Station, near Tennant Creek, is one of the sites the federal government has considered after it was volunteered by a branch of the Ngapa tribe in 2007.
But traditional owners of the site have taken their fight against the waste dump to the Federal Court.
The Australian Greens have described the process as a whitewash.
Greens MP Adam Bandt said the lower house committee had refused to hear from the public or the area's traditional owners.
"This is Martin Ferguson's appalling Christmas present for the people of Muckaty," Mr Bandt said.
The radioactive waste is now stored in suburban and regional areas across the nation under less than ideal management regimes, according to Mr Ferguson.
About 4000 cubic metres of low-level and short-lived intermediate-level radioactive waste has accumulated in Australia in the past 50 years.
The committee's report says the issue has been the subject of earlier inquiries, including a Senate committee, and there have been opportunities for comment in those hearings.
Mr Bandt said the report asked Mr Ferguson to meet the traditional owners - but so far he hadn't.
"The traditional owners of the proposed waste dump site, Muckaty Station, have also written to him requesting that he meet with them," Mr Bandt said.
"Martin Ferguson has ignored them.
"Instead of asking why or inviting the traditional owners to appear before the committee, the house committee chose not to receive any public submissions or any new information."
The draft laws would override the wishes of traditional owners, said Mr Bandt who, as a member of the committee, gave a dissenting report.
He said it was interesting the report was tabled while parliament was not sitting and just three days before Christmas.

description.hltext_display: Until casinos ban smoking, Vegas will lose business (51 comments)
description.content:
Regarding a story in the Dec. 13 , “Crusade to outlaw smoking in casinos is waged in hostile territory”:
I’m retired and travel a lot. I visited Las Vegas recently for the first time in eight years. I love the entertainment, great restaurants and I enjoy gambling, especially on sports.
But I will not come back until your city joins the 21st century and bans smoking in casinos. Your city is hurting and yet the people allow its elected officials to cater to the 20 percent of the population that smokes.
When it’s crowded on weekends, all casinos reek of smoke and I cannot even sit in a sports book and watch a game I bet on.
Recent studies on secondhand smoke conclude that it is almost as dangerous as smoking yourself. The health of all casino workers is being affected negatively as is the cost of health care in the Las Vegas area. I can personally attest to the fact that Las Vegas is also losing business as a result.
Why don’t the citizens of Las Vegas begin a grass-roots campaign and persuade elected officials to change the outdated smoking laws? Las Vegas would benefit in lots of ways.

description.hltext_display: House prices to fall slightly in 2011
description.content:
House prices will finish the year 2% lower than at the end of 2010, says RICS UK Housing Market Forecast published today.
Transactions are likely to remain flat, while repossessions will decline marginally, according to RICS.
Although house prices are likely to continue to slip over the coming months, falling supply should provide a platform for the market to stabilise at some stage in the first half of 2011. Indeed, RICS believes that, by the latter part of the year, prices could be edging up again, with the result that by the end of 2011 they may not be very different from where they currently stand.
A key risk to this view is that fall out from public spending cuts will have a bigger impact on the jobless total than envisaged, which will depress buyer interest by more than anticipated. However, even in these circumstances, the lack of supply will prevent the decline in prices amounting to more than 5%.
Despite the narrowing gap between demand and supply, it is likely the number of completed sales will remain flat. RICS estimates the average volume of transactions will amount to little more than 900,000 over the course of 2011.
Key indicators suggest the availability of mortgage finance will not show any significant increase, keeping transactions at roughly the same level as 2010.
Meanwhile, repossessions are likely to fall back marginally. In 2010, around 36,000 were taken into possession by lenders, but claims issued in the third quarter (the first stage of the possession process) were 26% lower than in the same period of 2009. RICS estimates the number of properties taken into possession will slip in 2011 to 33,000.
Commenting, Simon Rubinsohn, RICS chief economist said: “The lack of supply in the market is likely to prevent significant house price declines in 2011. The narrowing gap between supply and demand will see the gentle downward trend in prices currently taking place at least partly reversed as the year wears on.
“Transactions levels will remain flat as mortgage lending remains subdued for another year with many first-time buyers struggling to meet their aspirations of home ownership.”

event_or_fact.property: ?The lack of supply in the market is likely to prevent significant house price declines in 2011

description.hltext_display: Falcons are perfect
description.content: Photograph courtesy of Ainin Edman The fall campaign couldn't have gone any better for the Saratoga girls tennis team in 2010. It was a year that started with a championship at the prestigious California High School Tennis Classic in Fresno. From there the Falcons completed a perfect 25-0 season, and in the process won championships in the De Anza Division of the Santa Clara Valley Athletic League, the Central Coast Section and Northern California. Team members included, front row from left, Tiffany Tu and Lauren Kuan, and back row from left, Sarah Lum, coach Tom Uyehara, Crystal Yen, Mary Edman, Kalyani Narayan, Srinidhi Raghavan, Catherine Nguyen, Evaline Ju and Nikki Bedekar.

description.hltext_display: 'Charming' Walters is on all-league list
description.author: Dick Sparrer
description.content:
There are many opposing football players in the De Anza Division of the Santa Clara Valley Athletic League who would consider Saratoga two-way lineman Joe Walters charming.
Tough and hard-nosed, sure. Competitive, definitely. But charming? Not Walters.
But there was some charm to the way Walters ended his high school football career for the Falcons this fall. He found himself on the all-league first team for the third straight time. And you know what they say? The third time's the charm.
Walters joined seven teammates on the all-league team that was dominated by the team that won league, Central Coast Section and state championships this fall--Palo Alto.
It came as little surprise to see Paly put the most players on the list of special award winners in the division: Christoph Bono (Most Valuable Player), Davante Adams (Most Valuable Offensive Player), Kevin Anderson (Outstanding Lineman), Maurice Williams (Outstanding Wide Receiver), Michael Cullen (co-Outstanding Inside Linebacker) and T.J. Braff (Outstanding Utility Player).
Still, Saratoga had its share of players earn special recognition on the postseason squad.
Senior Kevin Smith was named the Outstanding Quarterback with senior Greg Johnson the Outstanding Outside Linebacker. Running back Troy Doles was named the Outstanding Junior.
Walters, the talented Saratoga center, was named to the all-league first team in the offensive line andyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); was joined on the squad by senior defensive lineman Alex Polcyn, junior inside linebacker Brandon Oliveri-O'Connor, junior outside backer Mitch Casas and senior wide receiver Chris Guengerich.
Smith completed 88 of 156 passes for 1,451 yards and 11 touchdowns this fall and Guengerich had 55 receptions for 772 yards and nine TDs.
Doles caught 16 passes for 407 yards and four scores and he carried the ball 78 times for 682 yards and eight touchdowns. Johnson had 98 carries for 606 yards and five TDs and he finished with 57 tackles on defense.
Oliveri-O'Connor was Saratoga's tackling leader with 77 stops.
Along with Smith, Johnson, Walters, Polcyn and Guengerich, seniors playing their final season for the Falcons were Peter Auvil, Bren Veziroglu, Marcus Hoffman, Hiro Nakata, Trevor Comes, Rick Wilson, Dean Stavropoulos, Chris Borgia, Jon Mastman, Steven Leslie, James Reed and Alex Patil. Lynbrook senior Shohei Hirota was tabbed the Most Outstanding Inside Linebacker in the El Camino Division of the SCVAL this fall.
Joining Hirota on the all-league list were a host of teammates: senior quarterback Billy Zamagni, senior running back Wes Wang, senior tight end James Estrada, lineman Daniel Truckai, senior defensive lineman Lucas Van Poetsch and junior defensive back Austin Brady. Senior setter Hanna Nielson won a spot on the all-league first team in the De Anza Division and senior outside hitter Sarah Blegen was picked to the second team for the Saratoga girls volleyball team.
The Falcons finished the season with a 10-11 record in league play and 11-22 overall.
Nielson, Blegen, Raven Sisco and Megan Brading were the only seniors on the 11-player roster for the Falcons. Players expected to return next fall include juniors Campbell Oreglia, Talia Sisco and Gabi Emerson; sophomores Janelle Williams and Ramya Swami; and freshmen Jennifer Ho and Katelyn Mollahan.
In the El Camino Division, Lynbrook's Gabriela Fine was named a co-Most Valuable along with Julia Li of Gunn and Kelsey Polochak of Cupertino.
Lynbrook seniors Tina Tran and Wai Lam Wong were selected to the all-league first team with freshman Sara Dyslin and junior Kelly Zhoa winning second-team honors.

description.hltext_display: Intercell startet klinische Phase I-Studie für neuen Impfstoff zur Vorbeugung von Infektionen durch C. difficile
description.content:
Wien (aktiencheck.de AG) - Die Intercell AG hat am Mittwoch den Start einer klinischen Phase I-Studie mit dem Impfstoffkandidaten IC84 zur Vorbeugung von Krankheiten, die durch das Bakterium Clostridium difficile (C. difficile) verursacht werden, bekannt gegeben. Der Erreger sei wesentlich für den Ausbruch von hospitalen Durchfallerkrankungen verantwortlich.
Wie der österreichische Impfstoffspezialist erklärte, ist der Impfstoffkandidat von Intercell ein auf rekombinanten Proteinen basierter Impfstoff, der aus zwei gekürzten Toxinen A und B von C. difficile besteht. Diese Toxine seien bekannterweise krankheitsverursachend; eine Antitoxin-Immunität könne schützend sein. Der Impfstoffkandidat werde sowohl mit als auch ohne das Adjuvans Aluminiumhydroxid getestet.
Den weiteren Angaben zufolge ist diese Phase I-Studie eine erste Studie am Menschen, um Daten zu Sicherheit und Immunogenität zu sammeln: Durchgeführt werde sie im ersten Teil an einer Gruppe von gesunden Erwachsenen zwischen 18 und 65 Jahren, im zweiten Teil an gesunden älteren Probanden im Alter von über 65 Jahren. Die zweite Altersgruppe stelle die Hauptzielgruppe für den Impfstoff gegen C. difficile dar. 60 gesunde Erwachsene und bis zu 100 ältere Probanden würden an dieser Open-Label-Studie teilnehmen. Es werden dabei drei verschiedene Impfstoff-Konzentrationen, die mit Alum adjuvantiert sind, getestet; zwei der drei Impfstoff-Konzentrationen werden auch ohne Adjuvans geprüft, hieß es.
Die Aktie von Intercell notierte gestern in Wien zuletzt mit einem Plus von 8,42 Prozent bei 11,98 Euro. (22.12.2010/ac/n/a)

description.hltext_display: US Poised To Approve Nuclear Arms Pact With Russia
description.content:
WASHINGTON -- The Senate is poised to approve a nuclear arms pact with Russia, handing President Barack Obama a huge victory on his top foreign policy priority.
Passage of the New START treaty appeared assured after 11 Republicans joined Democrats in a vote Tuesday to end debate on the pact. That signaled that Obama should have the two-thirds majority he needs when the Senate votes on final approval Wednesday.
The approval would mark a big comeback for Obama's arm controls efforts after the treaty appeared all but dead just weeks ago. It also would allow Obama to continue efforts to improve relations with Russia.
Ratification would mark a third recent major political victory for Obama, even though his Democratic party was trounced in last month's congressional elections. In recent days he won passage of a bipartisan tax deal and a vote ending the ban on gays openly serving in the military.
"We are on the brink of writing the next chapter in the 40-year history of wrestling with the threat of nuclear weapons," Foreign Relations Committee Chairman John Kerry, a Democrat, said after the vote.
The treaty would limit each country's strategic nuclear warheads to 1,550, down from the current ceiling of 2,200. It also would establish a system for monitoring and verification. U.S. weapons inspections ended last year with the expiration of a 1991 treaty.
The administration was adamant that it be ratified this year because the Democrats' majority in the Senate is set to shrink by five in January and waiting could have meant months of delay or defeat.
Republicans accused Democrats of rushing approval of the treaty for political reasons. They have asserted it would limit U.S. missile defense options and argued it has insufficient procedures to verify Russia's adherence.
When Jon Kyl, the leading Republican on negotiations over the treaty, suggested a delay last month, Obama appeared unlikely to find the nine Republican votes needed for passage.
But he and top members of his administration lobbied intensely, with Obama postponing his Christmas vacation in Hawaii. They enlisted support from top military officials and big-name Republicans from past administrations who argued the treaty was essential for U.S. national security.
In the end, they persuaded enough Republicans to defy the party's top two leaders in the Senate and support the pact.
"We know when we've been beaten," Republican Sen. Orrin Hatch told reporters hours before Tuesday's vote.
Even the Senate's No. 3 Republican, Lamar Alexander, endorsed the accord, saying he was assured U.S. defenses would not be weakened.
The treaty will leave the United States "with enough nuclear warheads to blow any attacker to kingdom come," Alexander said on the Senate floor.
Republicans had tried to kill the treaty by forcing changes in its language that would have sent it back for negotiations with Moscow. Democrats were working to appease some Republican senators by letting them raise these issues in legislation accompanying the treaty that would not directly affect the treaty.
Most Republicans remained opposed.
"The administration did not negotiate a good treaty," Kyl said. "They went into the negotiations it seems to me with the attitude with the Russians just like the guy who goes into the car dealership and says, 'I'm not leaving here until I buy a car.'"
Though Kyl looks likely to vote on the losing side of the debate over the treaty, in his negotiations with the administration he did win Obama's commitment to modernize the remaining nuclear arsenal with projected spending of $85 billion over 10 years.
Some of that money is now in the pipeline, contained in a stopgap government funding bill that cleared Congress on Tuesday. The measure would finance the government, mostly at current levels, through March 4.
It makes an exception for nuclear security programs, allowing the government to spend money to modernize the United States' nuclear arsenal at a rate equal to Obama's $624 million request.

description.hltext_display: Saratoga sports shorts: Baseball camp for youth
description.content:
Former Los Gatos baseball players Mike Denevi, Brad Sanfilippo, Justin Schafer and Carlos Alonso, who all went on to star at the collegiate level after standout careers as Wildcats, will head up a baseball camp for players ages 5-14 at Los Gatos High School on Dec. 29-30.
Camp hours are 9-11:30 a.m. for players ages 5-10 and noon-2:30 p.m. for players ages 11-14. The cost is $125 per player. For more information, call Sanfilippo at 408.857.2360 or Schafer at 408.891.9942.
Hot Stove
Major Leaguers Troy Tulowitzki of the Colorado Rockies, Jeremy Guthrie of the Baltimore Orioles and Daniel Nava of the Boston Red Sox will top the list of special award winners when the 27th annual Hot Stove Banquet returns to the San Jose Elks Club on Jan. 25.
The San Jose Giants will also be honored along with a host of minor league and amateur baseball players. Ted Robinson will serve as the master of ceremonies for the event that begins with no-host cocktails at 5:30 p.m., dinner at 6:45 p.m. and the awards at 7:30 p.m. The cost is $45 per person.
For more information, call Al Talboy at 408.446.3443.
Umps needed
Think you're up to making the calls? Then make a call to the Santa Clara Valley Federation of Umpires. The organization is looking for baseball umpires, experienced or not, to work Pinto, Mustang,
Bronco, Pony, Colt, Palomino and American Legion division games in the 2011 season.
The federation will provide training for all candidates. A training clinic will be held on Feb. 4-5 at Milpitas High School. For more information, visit www.scvfu.com, or contact Art Bruns at 408.985.8925 or brunsa@usa.redcross.org or Jim McAuley at 408.655.1551 or jrmcauley@gmail.com.

Leonardo DiCaprio has topped Forbes List of '2010's Top-Grossing Actors'.

description.hltext_display: Israel complains to UN over Gaza rockets
description.content:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu looks at the remains of homemade rockets …
Related Blogs
Jerusalem Post | Breaking … - 58 minutes ago
BlueOregon - Sun, 19 Dec 11:13 AM EST
Israel has called on the Security Council to issue a "clear and resolute" message against rockets fired into its territory from the Gaza Strip, in a letter to the United Nations body that was made public on Wednesday.
The December 21 letter, made public by Israel's foreign ministry, comes amid rising tensions on Israel's border with the coastal enclave.
On Tuesday, Israel launched a series of airstrikes against what it said were tunnels, training sites and weapons facilities in the Gaza Strip, in response to a salvo of mortar shells on Monday and rocket fire on Tuesday morning.
A Kassem rocket landed just metres (yards) away from a kindergarten in a southern Israeli kibbutz, wounding a teenage girl.
"The incidents of the past several days are part of an escalation of terrorist attacks emanating from Gaza that target Israeli civilians, towns, and military personnel," said the letter signed by Meron Reuben, Israel's UN ambassador.
"Israel holds the de facto authority in the Gaza Strip completely responsible for all of these incidents, which are carried out in clear violation of international law. In response to such attacks, Israel has exercised and will continue to exercise its right to self-defence."
The letter is addressed to US ambassador to the UN Susan Rice, the current chair of the Security Council, and UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.
It says three rockets and 18 mortars have been fired into parts of southern Israel from Gaza since December 19 alone.
"The Security Council, the Secretary-General, and the international community must send a clear and resolute message that these attacks are unacceptable," Reuben wrote.
"In addition, the Security Council must give appropriate attention to the smuggling of arms into Gaza, which continues to fuel violence and instability in our region."
On Tuesday, Israeli army chief Lieutenant General Gabi Ashkenazi warned that the relative calm that has prevailed since Israel's devastating Gaza offensive at the end of 2008 could quickly end.
"The situation is tense and fragile and could easily deteriorate, particularly if a rocket lands in a populated area," he told a parliamentary committee.
Between December 2008 and January 2009, Israel launched Operation Cast Lead, in response to hundreds of rockets fired from Gaza into the Jewish state.
The war cost the lives of 1,400 Palestinians, mostly civilians, and 13 Israelis, 10 of them soldiers.
Since then, the number of rocket attacks has dropped considerably, but the army says more than 200 rockets or shells have been fired this year.

description.hltext_display: 139家公司今年业绩有望翻番 八成公司业绩预喜
description.content:
作者：simuba 来源：私募吧 发表时间：2010-12-21
统计显示，在目前已经公布2010年业绩预告的700多家上市公司中，预喜公司占比接近八成，其中预计同比增幅有望翻番的公司达到139家。统计显示，截至12月20日，沪深A股近两千家上市公司中，共有753家公司发布了2010年年报业绩预告，其中业绩预喜公司超过600家，占比接近八....
已发布业绩预计的上市公司近八成“预喜”
年报预喜的上市公司行业分布
临近岁末，上市公司2010年经营情况逐步清晰，市场对年报业绩超预期个股的挖掘明显升温。统计显示，在目前已经公布2010年业绩预告的700多家上市公司中，预喜公司占比接近八成，其中预计同比增幅有望翻番的公司达到139家。
八成公司业绩预喜
不少上市公司在三季报披露的同时就已经对年报业绩进行了预测，而四季度以来又有30多家上市公司对2010年业绩进行预警。统计显示，截至12月20日，沪深A股近两千家上市公司中，共有753家公司发布了2010年年报业绩预告，其中业绩预喜公司超过600家，占比接近八成。
具体来看，在这753家公司中，有601家公司预喜，其中略增249家、预增212家、续盈86家、扭亏54家，合计占比达到79.8%。另外，业绩预亏和预减的公司分别有71家和65家，还有16家公司发布了“不确定”的业绩预告。
我们再统计这601家预喜公司所处的行业，机械设备行业股票最多，达到94家，化工、电子元器件、信息服务和医药生物行业各有68家、55家、44家、40家，单就这五大行业的公司，就占据了预喜公司总数的一半。
139家公司业绩有望翻番
就公司而言，601家预喜公司中，明确预计2010年全年净利润有望同比增加的有536家公司，其中预计同比增幅有望翻番的公司达到139家。
有5家公司预测增长1000%以上，大族激光是其中最为抢眼的公司，其早在10月22日就预告全年净利润增幅或将达到11900%-11930%。其它预增幅度较大的还有*ST南方、大港股份、S*ST生化和包钢稀土，预测净利润同比增幅最大值分别为2529%、2100%、1231%、1200%。
整体看，这536家有预测数据的公司，预测增幅平均值为117.25%，显示出明显的高增长态势。不过分析人士也指出，好的业绩并不一定等于好的市场表现，预增是个相对概念，上市公司业绩大幅向好，可能的确是经营有方，但也有可能是去年同期基数过低，或者是今年出现了重组等显著影响业绩的因素。
统计显示，预测业绩增幅超过200%的45家公司，四季度以来的市场表现明显分化。电子元器件行业的中环股份和大族激光表现最好，四季度以来累计涨幅达到71.15%和62.40%，此外中集集团、中钢天源、巨化股份、厦工股份的区间涨幅也都超过40%。不过，东风科技、景兴纸业、海翔药业等11只股票却出现下跌，预增350%的东风科技大跌17.64%，而预增1200%的包钢稀土的跌幅也接近10%。
与这些大幅预增但股价走低的股票形成鲜明对比的是，一些业绩平平甚至预亏预减的公司，却在四季度风生水起。例如预告续亏的滨海能源，预计2010年净利润为-5300万元至-4800万元，最大亏损或达13.81%，但其四季度以来的涨幅达到60.69%；最大预亏25%的彩虹精化，四季度以来涨幅高达74.14%。
对此分析人士表示，这些预告业绩平淡但二级市场表现火爆的公司，现在参与风险相对较高，而那些全年业绩大幅向好、近期市场表现不佳的公司，可能还具备一定的参与价值。当然，业绩只是一个参考条件，而且一些地产股、零售商业股往往存在四季度结算或在年末出现旺季等因素，年报业绩超预期的可能性较大，因此在布局年报行情的时候，还需多综合这些因素。
部分年报业绩预测增幅较大的公司

description.hltext_display: Forex: USD/CHF hits fresh 2-month low below 0.9545
description.content:
FXstreet.com (Barcelona) - Dollar retreat from Monday's high at 0.9720has extended below November and December lows, at 0.9545/55, ad the pair reached a fresh 2-month low at 0.9530, although the pair has not yet confirmed below 0.9545 level, which is under bearish pressure at the moment.
On the downside, below 0.9545 (Nov 5 low), nest support levels lie at 0.9500/15 (psychological level/Daily pivot Point S2), and 0.9481 (Oct 15 low).
On the upside, resistance levels lie at 0.9580 (session high), and above here, 0.9610 and 0.9640 (intra-day resistance levels).

description.hltext_display: City recognizes scouts with commendation
description.author: Brian Babcock
description.content:
The Saratoga Cub Scout Pack 508 isn't letting its youth get in the way of accomplishing its many goals.
Just in the past year, the 5- to 10-year-olds donated the fourth largest collection of food in Santa Clara County to the Second Harvest Food Bank and collected and donated 80 pounds of candy for Operation Gratitude, which sends the sweets to military men and women stationed oversees.
All of it meets the Cub Scouts' values, which asks all members to give their best effort to being honest and doing what's right. And on Dec. 15 the Saratoga City Council honored Pack 508 with a commendation, which congratulated the children for their achievements and dedication to the community.
"There are several things that the Cub Scouts aim for, but what I would say we're doing is doing our best to raise gentlemen," said cub master Roy Lagemann. "They're going to be honest, they're going to have respect for their elders, they're going to tolerate different points of view. They're also going to be unafraid to speak their own voice."
Pack 508 is the oldest chartered Cub Scout group in Saratoga, according to those associated with the pack. The pack was founded in May 1965 by the Fruitvale Elementary School Parent Teacher Association.
The charter then moved to the Argonaut Elementary School Booster Club and then the school's PTA. Lagemann said he and the rest of those associated with Pack 508 appreciate the support the PTA has given to them.
Noyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); matter who has sponsored the group, the virtues have always stayed the same. Among other values, the children are taught to be trustworthy, loyal, helpful and friendly.
The pack participates annually in the Saratoga Creek clean-up, makes donations to Meals on Wheels, collects and delivers items to various organizations, such as the San Jose Animal Shelter, and volunteers many other hours to community projects.
The young members might not understand what they're doing now, said Lagemann, but all the volunteer work they do builds character.
"Just like anything else. "... Boys when they're young, they don't quite necessarily get it. But they're with their friends and they're having fun, so the reinforcement is there. And as they get older they notice, 'Ah, there's a side effect to what we do and what I'm doing is benefitting someone; and gosh, this is fun. It's not taking anything away from my life; in fact, it's benefitting someone else,' " Lagemann said.
Tamami Honma, committee chairwoman with the pack, said the parents appreciated the council's commendation.
"The council made the meeting really inclusive and got the element of fun into the meeting for the benefit of the young ones in the audience, and that effort really made an impression on me personally," Honma said. "I'm very proud to be a member of this community with representatives like that."
